title: Wifi "Connecting" to "Saved" - What to test/replace?
content: Hello. I found out last year that the case for my Google Pixel XL is definitely NOT waterproof. The phone turns on and pretty much functions as it did before the event I call "the accident". The Wifi shows the available networks (albeit a very weak signal) and constantly goes from "connecting" to "saved" until showing the network at "disabled". I have tried changing the IP, resetting the phone, booting in "Safe Mode" to see if it was an app causing the issue, and have finally simply done a factory reset with the result being the same. I have seen posts with comments stating that the next step might be a replacement... but replace what, exactly? What should I test to see if its the motherboard, wifi wires, etc.? I am willing to do, and have the necessary tools to do, a parts replacement. I just need to know what you believe is the part that highest chance of being the one that needs to be replaced so I am not spending an arm and a leg attempting to fix it. Thank you in advance for your assistance. :)
